project_descr: Support for in-depth assessment of urban poverty in Ha Noi and Ho Chi Minh City.

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
Further to the agreement reached between Ha Noi and Ho Chi Minh Cities People's Committees on UNDP's support for conducting an Urban Poverty Survey in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh Cities, a Detailed Project Outline (DPO) for the UNDP-supported Project "Support for In-depth assessment of urban poverty in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City" has been developed by the partners in close cooperation with General Statistics Office (GSO) and other associates (Viet Nam Academy of Social Sciences (VASS)/Centre for Analysis and Forecasting (CAF) and Ho Chi Minh City Institute for Development Studies (HIDS)). The DPO has been endorsed and sent by the two cities People's Committees to the Government of Viet Nam (GOVN) for appraisal and approval. To ensure the timely preparation and implementation of the Survey, UNDP Country Director, in close consultation with the GOVN Aid Coordination Agencies (represented by Ministry of Planning and Investment - MPI) and Ha Noi and HCMC People's Committees, will issue an Advance Authorization that enables an early start of the implementation of the Project.       

This MOU is made to lay out the agreements between partners on their partnership, as well as mechanisms and arrangements aim at allowing the necessary flexibility for the partners, in preparing for the implementation of the "Urban Poverty Survey in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh Cities", covering the period before the above-mentioned DPO will be approved by the GOVN and the above-mentioned Project will be fully operational. After that period, the collaboration will be according to the existing GOVN-UNDP guidelines for implementing and managing UNDP-supported projects in Viet Nam. Under the duly signed MOU, two main following activities would be carried out:

•	Develop sampling techniques, develop the survey sampling frame to ensure minimum "missing" of the poor and migrants and prepare the survey questionnaires which link to the VHLSS questionnaire to ensure comprehensive and adequate analysis on urban poverty, draft survey guidelines and training manuals.
•	Test in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City the sampling methods and questionnaires and finalization of training manuals/survey implementation guidelines. Recruit survey testing manager. Prepare and test tabulation plan (with special attention to meeting the needs for sex and age disaggregated data). Print and distribute questionnaires, enumerator training manuals and materials, survey management/ implementation guidelines/ manuals for the pilot. More detailed reasonability from partners are detailed in the Work Plan annexed

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
Support for in-depth assessment of urban poverty in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City. There are 3 outputs under this project:
Project Output 1: New urban-poverty data generated, disaggregated by sex and age, and allowing for good quality analysis on the characteristics, scope, depth and composition of poverty situation in Ha Noi and Ho Chi Minh City.
Project Output 2:  Policy research conducted, providing good quality analysis of new data generated by the survey, and research results widely debated and disseminated. 
Project Output 3:  Policy responses developed based on the evidences and results of the survey, policy research and debates
